content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. The following histogram shows the distribution of house values in a certain city. The mean of the distribution is <math alttext="403,000 dollars"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>403</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and the standard deviation is <math alttext="278,000 dollars"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>278</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Suppose one house from the city will be selected at random. Use the histogram to estimate the probability that the selected house is valued at less than <math alttext="500,000 dollars"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>500</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show your work.

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. The following histogram shows the distribution of house values in a certain city. The mean of the distribution is <math alttext="403,000 dollars"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>403</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and the standard deviation is <math alttext="278,000 dollars"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>278</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Suppose one house from the city will be selected at random. Use the histogram to estimate the probability that the selected house is valued at less than <math alttext="500,000 dollars"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>500</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show your work.

(b) Suppose a random sample of <math alttext="40"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> houses are selected from the city. Estimate the probability that the mean value of the <math alttext="40"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> houses is less than <math alttext="500,000 dollars"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>500</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show your work.

To estimate a population mean <math alttext="mu"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, the sample mean <math alttext="x bar"><mstyle><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></mstyle></math> is often used as an estimator. However, a different estimator is called the sample midrange, given by the formula <math alttext="the fraction sample minimum plus sample maximum, over 2"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>sample minimum + sample maximum</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. (c) The following table shows the values, in thousands of dollars, of <math alttext="40"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> randomly selected houses in the city. <math alttext="34"><mstyle><mrow><mn>34</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="38"><mstyle><mrow><mn>38</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="95"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="110"><mstyle><mrow><mn>110</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="137"><mstyle><mrow><mn>137</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="140"><mstyle><mrow><mn>140</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="155"><mstyle><mrow><mn>155</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="155"><mstyle><mrow><mn>155</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="169"><mstyle><mrow><mn>169</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="207"><mstyle><mrow><mn>207</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="209"><mstyle><mrow><mn>209</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="314"><mstyle><mrow><mn>314</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="314"><mstyle><mrow><mn>314</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="323"><mstyle><mrow><mn>323</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="343"><mstyle><mrow><mn>343</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="347"><mstyle><mrow><mn>347</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="349"><mstyle><mrow><mn>349</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="363"><mstyle><mrow><mn>363</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="369"><mstyle><mrow><mn>369</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="389"><mstyle><mrow><mn>389</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="397"><mstyle><mrow><mn>397</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="595"><mstyle><mrow><mn>595</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="600"><mstyle><mrow><mn>600</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="1,084"><mrow><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>084</mn></mrow></math> (i) Calculate the sample midrange for the data. (ii) Explain why the sample midrange might be preferred to the sample mean as an estimator of the population mean.

(d) To investigate the sampling distribution of the sample midrange, a simulation is performed in which <math alttext="100"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> random samples of size <math alttext="n equals 40"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> were selected from the population of house values. For each sample, the sample midrange was calculated and recorded on the following dotplot. The mean of the distribution of sample midranges is <math alttext="617,000 dollars"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>617</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> with standard deviation <math alttext="136,000 dollars"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>136</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the results of the simulation, explain why the sample mean might be preferred to the sample midrange as an estimator of the population mean.

topic.text: 1.7: Summary Statistics for a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
